title: John Virgo: A Snooker Star Who Made People Smile
summary: John Virgo was a famous snooker player and TV host who has died at age 79. He played snooker professionally for 18 years and won a big tournament called the UK Championship. After he stopped playing, he became a commentator for the BBC, where he talked about snooker games on TV. Many people knew him from a fun TV show called Big Break, where he presented with a comedian. He was loved for his catchphrase 'where's the cue ball going?' when players were about to make a mistake. Other snooker stars, like Ronnie O'Sullivan and Mark Selby, said they were very sad and will miss him a lot. John Virgo also did trick shots and impressions to entertain fans.
